title: PM Attends Japanese Emperor's Enthronement Ceremony
text:
He later told reporters the event allowed him to experience "Japan's impressive history and culture."

Around 400 dignitaries from 174 countries attended the ceremony, including Chinese Vice President Wang Qishan. Lee sat next to Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha and Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyễn Xuân Phúc during the ceremony.

Prime Minister Lee Nak-yon attended the enthronement ceremony of Japan's new emperor Naruhito in Tokyo on Tuesday.

Lee did not find a chance to get up close and personal with Emperor Naruhito or Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe during the ceremony, but exchanged greetings with Naruhito at a banquet later that day. He also delivered a personal letter from President Moon Jae-in to the Japanese government addressing the emperor.

Prior to his departure on Tuesday morning, Lee briefly spoke with Japanese Ambassador to Korea Yasumasa Nagamine, who appeared at an airport in Seongnam, Gyeonggi Province to see off him.

Lee said, "I do not expect everything to be solved by this one visit, but it will offer a chance to take one step forward."

Bilateral relations between the two neighboring countries have soured since the Supreme Court here in 2018 ordered Japanese companies to compensate Korean victims of forced labor during World War II.
description: PM Attends Japanese Emperor's Enthronement Ceremony
